name: Cooked Turkey (Plain)
caution: NO bones (splinter risk), NO skin (high fat), NO seasonings, NO onions/garlic stuffing
description: Plain cooked turkey breast is lean protein source. Remove ALL bones, skin, and seasonings. No Thanksgiving turkey with butter, herbs, or stuffing. Plain boiled or baked only.

name: Cooked Beef (Lean)
caution: Choose lean cuts. No seasoning. Cook thoroughly. Limit fatty cuts.
description: Lean cooked beef provides high-quality protein, iron, zinc, B vitamins. Choose lean cuts like sirloin. Cook plain without salt, garlic, onions. Higher in fat than chicken - moderate portions.

name: Zucchini
serving_suggestions: Steamed, chopped, or pureed. Raw okay but harder to digest.
description: Zucchini extremely low calorie (17 cal/100g) perfect for weight management. High water content aids hydration. Vitamins C, potassium. Steam and chop for easy digestion.

name: Celery
serving_suggestions: Cut into small bite-size pieces to prevent choking
caution: Cut into small pieces - stringy texture can be choking hazard
description: Celery very low calorie (14 cal/100g), high water content. Helps freshen breath. Crunchy texture dogs enjoy. MUST cut into small pieces as stringy fibers can cause choking.

name: Mango (Flesh Only)
serving_suggestions: Remove skin and pit completely. Small cubes of flesh only.
caution: MUST remove pit (choking/obstruction hazard) and skin
description: Mango flesh safe in moderation. Rich in vitamins A, C, E and fiber. Sweet taste appealing. Remove ALL skin and pit completely. Pit is choking and obstruction hazard. High in sugar so occasional treat only.

name: Cantaloupe
serving_suggestions: Remove rind and seeds. Cut into small cubes.
description: Cantaloupe low calorie (34 cal/100g), high in vitamins A, B, C, and beta-carotene. Good for hydration. Sweet taste. Remove rind and seeds. Cut into bite-size pieces.

name: Quinoa (Cooked Plain)
serving_suggestions: Cooked plain with water. No seasonings. Small amounts mixed in meals.
description: Quinoa is complete plant protein with all 9 essential amino acids. Good source of fiber, magnesium, iron. Gluten-free grain alternative. Cook plain. Small amounts as meal topper or occasional treat.

name: Brown Rice (Cooked Plain)
serving_suggestions: Cooked plain. Mix with chicken for bland diet.
description: Brown rice provides complex carbs for energy, fiber, B vitamins. More nutritious than white rice. Easily digestible. Common in bland diets for upset stomach (mixed with boiled chicken). Cook plain - no butter or seasonings.

name: Human Medications
symptoms: varies by medication - vomiting, seizures, organ failure, death
safe_amount: 0g - NEVER give human meds without vet approval
description: Human medications are top cause of pet poisoning. Even over-the-counter drugs like ibuprofen, acetaminophen (Tylenol -deadly to cats in tiny amounts), and cold medicines can be fatal. Pets metabolize drugs differently. NEVER give pets human medications without explicit vet approval. Keep all medicines secure.

name: Sago Palm
safe_amount: 0g - entire plant toxic, seeds most dangerous
description: Sago palm (cycad plant) extremely toxic - all parts poisonous, seeds most deadly. Ingestion causes vomiting within hours, progressing to liver failure and often death. Even small amounts can be fatal. Common ornamental plant - keep away from pets. Emergency vet immediately if ingested.
